title: Sophia Loren dazzles at 85 as she picks up lifetime achievement award in Vienna
text:

Sophia Loren looked every inch the Queen of Hollywood as she picked up her lifetime achievement award at a glittering ceremony in Vienna on Sunday night.

The 85-year-old starlet was presented with the European Culture Award Taurus by her 50-year-old son Carlo Ponti Jr.

The veteran actress looked visibly shocked as she graciously accepted the accolade in the Austrian capital.

Dressed in a striking floor-length embellished red gown with an eye-catching criss-cross pattern across her chest and a long train, Sophia completed her stunning look with diamond encrusted pearl drop earrings paired with a matching necklace.

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

The 85-year-old looked years younger as she styled her short auburn brown hair into tight curls that accentuated her striking features, opting for an ultra glam look with false lashes and nude lipstick.

Sophia looked elegant as she was escorted on stage to accepted the award from Carlo Jr, who tenderly planted a kiss on her cheek as he handed it over.

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: APA/AFP via Getty Images)

She returned his affections by grabbing him tightly and planting a smacker on his cheek.

Looking delighted with herself, the actress was then seen waving to the crowds and blowing them kisses.

She clutched her chest with gratitude as the crowds erupted with applause.

The award comes just months after the Rome-born actress, who is considered to be one of Italy’s national treasures, was seen filming for her first role in a decade.

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

(Image: CHRISTIAN BRUNA/EPA-EFE/REX)

In July, she was pictured make-up free and in character for her role in The Life Before Us in Bari, Southern Italy.

Dressed in a red shawl, slippers and floral skirt, Sophia was being pushed around in a wheelchair by a young boy during filming.

The movie, which is titled “La Vita Davanti” in Italian, is directed by Sophia’s other son Edoardo Ponti and is based on a book of the same name.
